content: I noticed a lot of frames are missing, along with some lagging. This is noticeable in games like Centipede and Megamania, as well as Dark Cavern.
Emulator works ok but has no games with it so couldnt really use it disapointing for a paid app

it does not work

The only Good Atari VCS emulator on play store and only legal means to get it is buying it im enjoying it and able to play rare Atari VCS games without searching for cartridges and i can also play Chetiry(Best Atari Tetris HomeBrew) on the go. And i can play My Favourite Atari Game The Smurfs on my chromebook to just have more fun on my Chromebook

Indeed
So far so good will update as I test it out

Sleek and refined, but light on options for the virtual controls. An option to use a slider for paddle controls or a simple bar you can drag your finger on for the driving controller (like the paddle controller but spins infinitely) would be great. I would bump it up to five stars for those things alone.
Does not work. Tried with multiple ROMs which work fine in other emulators and if I'm lucky I get buzzing and vertical lines of random colors. Need a refund.
Stays just black after launching the app. The developer responded to my support request after 5 days.
Thank You for paddle support. It is so great been able to play Super Breakout and other great paddle games on the go.üòÅ
So far so good. Got a roms pack with 2500+ games. Looking forward to bringing back childhood memories.
Back to working on my chromebook... like an old friend coming to visit. Very pleased to have this app functional again.
It's light on the bells and whistles, but it's functional and has full controller support.
Love this app. Totally worth the $3
Does not work on my Samsung Galaxy tablet, cannot even select the game. I want my money back asap.
Works great, but I can't figure out how to use the virtual paddle for certain games.
Just great
As good as it gets for 2600 games on mobile!

I gave this app 5 stars only because it enables me to play the old Atari games. However, it should work with all the games, but I found that some which require paddle or keyboard controllers don't seem to work. If there is an option for this within the app, I have no idea how to access it. I hope the program developer will make it possible to play other games besides the ones that are joystick types.
Works great!

Overall an extremely well written application. Looks nice and is simple to get running. Has many settings. That beimg said I which I had looked at the date it was last updated. Few bugs that need worked on. Has the app neen abandoned?
Take me back to when I had an Atari 2600 Jr Works like a dream
I had an ATARI2600 in 1984, I was 4 years old playing these games, I loved them. I'm playing on a Hauwei P20 and it's a solid emulation. Good response time and latency, Great work, guys!
Best emu for 2600
I like this Atari 2600 emulator. I use to have one of this back then. It was my first Arcade emulator before i had other Arcades emulator. It's good to have it again. it's bring back memories.
audio is broken, developer is not responding

Very nice emulator, but it needs to be updated and based on Stella 5.x. 
Tried to play a homebrew port of Mappy and it wouldn't work because the 
detail of programming in the ROM requires Stella 5.x.

Still crashes a lot when task switching. Image is vertically stretched in 
4:3 mode compared to actual 2600. As is the Master System emulator.
Great so far! But please add some controls to run 2600 BASIC!

I can't even get it to start! It just shows all the files on my computer, 
but I can't even get it to work! I wrote the game developer, but no 
response. üò´üò´üò´
The best Atari 2600 emulator available and the recent update has made the controls more smooth. Great stuff!
I've only tried a couple games so far. (For hours)  I couldn't be happier!  Pleasant trip through my childhood. You guys nailed it!  I strongly recommend this app
No longer working since I upgraded to Marshmallow. Immediately after opening the app I see the menu but the app is frozen.
Maravilloso todo, pero hay dos cosas que ser√≠a bueno tener en √©ste emulador. La conexi√≥n con Google Chromecast y la posibilidad de quitar el bot√≥n Turbo.
Great emulator!

Games play nice and smooth, but no sound at all. Using M9C MAX Android TV Box, S905x, Mali 450 GPU.  Fixed audio problems by lowering the Audio Rate to something lower than 48khz.  Now giving 5 stars for a perfect emulator.
*Note to LG G5 users: I had to go into Video Options and change the GPU Copy Mode from "auto" to "standard" to get this to work on my G5*
Awesome compatibility. I wish there was option to add game boxart, and additional information I.e. game manuals, history developer interviews ect ect from menu
Works oerfectly!
Is there a way I can add a shortcut to switch to player 2 since radar lock needs pad 2 to switch weapons.
Works perfectly, with a gamepad even better
I am using Android TV, a Shield, and the game selection process needs improvements. I suggest something similar to Stella for Windows.
The sound is about half a second behind.  Other than that a great app.  I figured that for a paid app the sound would be better.
Works great again. Thanks for fixing the issues.
.emu series are the most solid emulators on Android.
I love all of Robert Broglia's emulators.
Thank you Stella, for giving me my games back! Excellent emulator!
Just like my old console

all games work great!  Great emulator, thank you!  This is easily the best 2600 emulator.  Would a 7800 emulator be possible one day?  Might not work on Marshmallow devices either
A combination of this and FolderSync on my android TV lets me sync my games and saved states between my TV, tablet and phone, and works well with bluetooth gamepads.
There are plenty of options for adding input via Bluetooth, onboard gpio, etc. I wish the menu was a bit more organized. That and an on-screen keyboard controller would be great.
I want my f######money back!

Had an itch to play some Pitfall 2 while on the road and got this emulator. Works perfectly on my S5.
If you want to play Atari 2600 games on your Android...get this app. It works perfectly with all my ROMs.
Perfect
Perfect on my Galaxy Grand 2!

Great Atari 2600 emulator, can't really think of anything that could be improved.  If you don't know how to set up and run emulators then don't download this then give it one star because you don't know what you're doing.

I've been a fan for years. You really can't beat any of Robert's excellent emulators, including this one. Accurate emulation and very full-featured. Worth the money.

Totally AWESOME!!!

Just like i remembered,good old early 80s gaming
Robert Broglia's emulators are some of the best for Amdroid. I recommend them highly, you won't regret them, trust me!
Great emulator, but would love Moga controller support.
Do you support paddle controllers directly instead of via d-pad?  Stella android emulated paddles via touchscreen, but KitKat broke it.
Is it me or does this guy go missing for months at a time..too bad cause he makes amazing emulators
Play classic games on Android?  Yes.
But it works well...
Retro heaven!

I just installed this on my NVIDIA Shield and all of the ROMs I tested, except 1 - Zaxxon - worked as expected.  This could be due to my ROM file, but it's not really much of an issue because 1) there are so many other AWESOME Atari games and 2) there are a few other ports of Zaxxon that are far superior to the Atari version.  I only fiddled with a few options (like screen size and removing the "virtual joystick" image from the screen), leaving most of the settings as they were, and I didn't run into any problems.  I've tried a number of emulators and this one is, by far, one of the most user friendly I've encountered.  I can't wait to try out the C64 emulator by this same developer!  If Robert Broglia came out with a MAME emulator and/or Atari 5200 emulator, I'd snatch it up in a heartbeat!

I own all of Robert Broglia's emulators, and they are always the best.  With a very consistent interface and high compatibility/performance, they set the standard.  My only complaint is that he should make more of them!!
Ahh yes the good ole atari sound effects ..beeps dings and farts...cannot go wrong ...
Moga support? I love you!
Its great and all but can you please update it to play 7800 and 5200 games. Thanks

This emulator is awesome. Not only it is fully compatible with all my ROMs but also it is rather smart as it adapts itself to a variety of situations, screen sizes, resolutions, orientation, and so on. Love it.
It's a great emulator but would be better if it had a cleaner UI showing all your roms in a list type library with cartridge images and compatibility with other Atari consoles like the 5200 and 7800.
I like it even better than the original 2600. The controls are much better now.

I have many in the series here just for the interface consistancy.  A few annoyances are there when using on the Nvidia Shield though.  When scrolling the ROM list, which can be quite big, it is cumbersome with the dpad.  This should be improved for users with physical devices.  For one thing holding the d-pad down only advances one entry, no key repeat.  That should be added.  Also d-pad right should go down a page, left up a page also with repeat (See MAME4 droid) makes navigation MUCH faster.  I know I can use the touch screen but it is not as convenient with physical controls to put down the controller scroll by touching the screen (and adding smudges), then go back and pick up the controler again just to change a game.  Otherwise great emu.
I love  but not as good as my real 2600  because I Need second controller
Awesome emulator!  The best way to play your 2600 games on the go.
Like everyone says, this emulator is awesome. So far everything works the same or even better than on a pc emulator
Does not work on note 10.1
what can i say? perfect?   thank you once again! any chance you can add touch pad support for the Xperia play?  thanks!
I have had sound work only once on my stock Asus TF700T.  Not as fun without sound.  Please fix and will rate 5 stars.  Thanks
The perfect emulator! No lag, smooth as butter, and has great controls! I want to give 6 stars instead of 5!
Works awesome!!
It's the best Atari 2600 emulator, I recommend it.
It runs so smoothly its incredible good job keep em coming
Wii remote interface using Bluetooth is flawless...so much fun being able to play Freeway, Adventure, etc., again.  Made me feel like I did when we got the unit the Christmas it was released!
I love replaying tapper
Works great!
Every emulator made by this developer is excellent and works fantastic!

Menus are easy to navigate.  Emu runs great on my Nexus 7.  Smooth emulation, looks better than my console does.  Easy controller mapping to my BT gamepad.   Can't quite get used to the native touch controls but Atari really needs a joystick so not the dev's fault.
Great emulator, worth the price.
Realy good works fine on my phone. Brings me back to the Atari age before the bit wars. 5 stars for being the best Atari console emulator
Before update my only complaint would have been that i couldn't program both controllers into my gamepad.  This has been addressed now.  Yet another fantastic emulator.
I love it!had small issue with white screen,sent emailed,fast response,fixed.don't hesitate,if you're looking for an Atari emulator,get this one.

This emulator is worth the $3. Supports the iCade 8Bitty bluetooth controller from Think Geek and runs fast, smooth and with audio. I haven't tested Supercharger ROM images like DragonStomper yet...
Nexus 7 works sublime.... now this IS worthy of the money.
Thanks for bringing the Atari VCS to the 'droid world!  I still remember that Christmas a few decades ago when I got my Heavy Sixer....ahhh the memories.
Excellent.

Aahhh! The memory of being 7 years old again. Thanks RB... truly. A stella Dev and a Historian.
Works great on NTSC ROMs but PAL ROMs play too fast .. they should play at 25fps. Love being able to use wiimotes for controllers. GREAT JOB :-)
Much love!!!!

I've been hoping for quite a while that you would put out an Atari emulator, and you did, and it is just as awesome as I hoped for.  2 issues though: 1. Unless I'm missing something, it seems to be impossible to play games that require paddles, such as Circus Atari. 2. I couldn't get Dig Dug to load. No idea why.  I'm sure with time these issues will be solved. It was definitely money well spent.

Robert Broglia has made another superb emulator. I've got 5 of his now. They are the best on the market, and all play brilliantly. Thanks Robert.
Much better than Ataroid! No more fuzzy video filters! Xperia Play.

I was *really* hoping the Atari 2600 would be on the list, and here it is!  This is one of my favorite old consoles, and Robert's port of Stella is top notch.  I also know, from owning his other emulators, that I'll get regular updates.  All I need now is a Robert Broglia C64 emulator, and I'll be in heaven!  I tested this emulator on both the Xperia Play and ASUS Transformer with the iControlPad.  Both work perfectly.
